list_definition.definition: a small (usually folding) case made of soft leather, plastic etc, carried in the pocket and used for holding (especially paper) money, personal papers etc; billfold American
a similar case containing other things

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a plastic wallet containing a set of small tools.

list_ex_of_english: Our message on meat imports is currently advertised on seven million ticket wallets for long-haul destinations.
What about a motorist who carries his driving licence with him, but loses his wallet?
In the free document wallet, notably there was a tie.
But before he could make his speech of welcome, they stripped off his suit, taking his watch and wallet into the bargain.
She invented a new phrase tonight about the council tax being a light touch on people's wallets.
I remembered that in the school bag there was my wallet with $100 in it, and all my anatomy textbooks.
It does not cover pen and pencil holders as wallets.
There must be scope for hitting the persistent hooligan very sharply through his wallet.
